head.title: COVID-19 Information Updates – COVID-19 Information Updates – Cameron Parish School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: Cameron Parish School District serves K-12th grade students and is located in Cameron, LA.

div.p: Cameron Parish School Board will continue to provide meals once a week (Tuesdays) for the remainder of April.

p.em: **Starting the week of May 4, 2020, the parish will transition to The Healthy School Food Collaborative. This program will deliver a week’s worth of meals (5 breakfast, 5 lunches, 5 snacks, & 5 suppers) to Cameron Parish families who sign up. Be sure to list ALL children 0-18 even if they are not in school. In order to participate in this program each family will need to register:

div.p: If you have any questions or difficulties registering for this service, please email me at holly_castile@camsch.org.

strong.span: **Only those who sign up through the link above will receive food delivery starting May 4. It is very important that you sign up as soon as possible so that we can begin mapping out delivery routes. You do not have to be home when the meals are delivered.

ul.li: We will serve meals next week (Spring Break) on Tuesday, April 14, 2020.

We have updated our list of families picking up food. If you did not pick up food yesterday, and plan to pick up food next week please email holly_castile@camsch.org to be added to the list. We will only prepare enough for the number of families that picked up yesterday unless notified by Monday at noon. If you have picked up food in the past, BUT did NOT pick up yesterday then please email holly_castile@camsch.org to ensure we prepare enough food without wasting.
If you will NOT pick up next week, please email holly_castile@camsch.org or your school administration.

div.div: The district will remain closed through April 30, 2020. The office is working on plans based on the Governor's Stay at Home order. If the order is lifted at the end of April, the district will have a district wide In-Service Day on May 1, 2020. We will look forward to our students returning on May 4, 2020.
The COVID-19 Questions and Answers was updated with answers to questions concerning School Graduation and weekly Meal Service.

div.br: Beginning the Week of March 30, 2020, the Cameron Parish School Board will serve meals only ONCE per week. Meals may be picked up on Tuesdays from 2:00 – 3:30 pm

div.div: Each child will receive 4 breakfasts, 4 lunches, milk, and juice. If there are any changes to times or locations, the CPSB will notify the public.

div.br: The School Nutrition Program hopes to continue to provide meals to the children of Cameron Parish while still protecting our employees. Reducing the program to one day per week will hopefully allow us to do both. Any questions should be directed to Dr. Holly Castile at holly_castile@camsch.org.
The Office of Emergency Preparedness (OEP) will provide assistance to the CPSB by distributing the meals at each location.
**Instructions for safe food handling will be included with the meals

div.strong: Information from the Louisiana Workforce Commission concerning a minor release for students seeking employment.

div.div: More information can be found at Minors to Work Information.

div.strong: School News App for everyone-download the App today!

div.div: School News App by Edlio will keep you up to date with our News Feed and calendars. Please add the district and your school to start getting updates through this app.

div.strong: Click the link below for instructions on how to download the App.

div.div: Governor John Bel Edwards has released a letter to School Board Members and Superintendents.
We wanted everyone to have access to the latest information concerning Louisiana Education.

a.title: Letter from Governor John Bel Edwards

div.a: Letter from Governor John Bel Edwards

p.span: Beginning Wednesday, March 18, the Cameron Parish School Board will be providing to-go breakfast and lunch meals for anyone 18 and under, including students with disabilities through age 22. Those meals can be obtained Monday-Thursday from 11:00 am – 12:30 pm at the following locations:

span.style: font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: 'Arial Rounded MT Bold',sans-serif
font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: 'Arial Rounded MT Bold',sans-serif

p.span: In addition, meals may be picked up at the Cameron Parish School Board office in Cameron from 11:30 am – 12:00 pm. Any person needing to pick up meals at the Cameron Parish School Board Office must contact Dr. Holly Castile at (337) 775-5784 ext. 1013 or email at

strong.span: The CPSB will allow any student in grades 4-12 to “check out” their Chromebook for educational use during the school closure.

p.span: It can be used for educational purposes only and will be monitored through our content filtering system. The CPSB website has a list of resources that can be used to help students maintain skills during the school closure.

strong.span: If you want to pick up your child’s Chromebook you can pick it up from the school bus circle at the following times.

div.div: Superintendent, Charley Lemons has prepared a list of questions and answers that pertain to the COVID-19 pandemic as it affects employees, students, parents/guardians and other stakeholders.

div.span: As a district we are working to implement a meal service for ALL students in our parish. This service will be for all children 18 years of age and younger regardless of the school/school system in which the child is enrolled. In addition, overage students enrolled in public K-12 schools, including students with disabilities through age 22, are eligible for the free meals at open sites. Children's meals must be counted and claimed by the school site that served the meal. Your child does NOT have to receive free or reduced lunches to qualify. In order for us to plan, we would like for you to complete the following survey by 8:00 AM, Tuesday, March 17, 2020.

div.div: Click below to complete the survey.

div.strong: Please complete only 1 survey, whether you do it through email, website, or FaceBook.

div.div: If you have questions or concerns, please email Dr. Castile at holly_castie@camsch.org

p.strong: At this time all Cameron Parish School Board facilities and operations are closed/suspended beginning Monday March 16th 2020.

div.p: The system administrative team will meet on Monday to devise a plan for the reminder of the mandatory statewide shutdown. The system will post all information on the systems website as plans are finalized. Please monitor the systems website for updates. This will be the main source of information dissemination for the system, as well as through the local media.

All fiscal functions of the school system will continue uninterrupted at this time, this includes but is not limited to payroll and accounts payable functions. We will continue to monitor the situation and make notification of any changes on the Cameron Parish School Board website. You can contact the business office through email if you have any concerns or questions. All central office staff email addresses are available on the system’s website, and the staff will continuously monitor incoming email. Please utilize the systems employee self-service portal for any document needs you may have.

nav.aria-label: Navigation for COVID-19 Information Updates section

a.span: Updates from LA Department of Education

div.p:
The Cameron Parish School Board does not condone and will not discriminate against any student on the basis of sex and abides by the requirements of Title IX of the Educational Amendments of 1972 and its implementing regulations.
Students and parents may submit a report or complaint of alleged sex discrimination against a student, including alleged sexual harassment, to the student's principal at the school site or to the District's Title IX Coordinator, Superintendent Charles Adkins, Cameron Parish School Board, 510 Marshall Street, Cameron, LA, 70631; (337) 775-5784, or charles_adkins@camsch.org.
The School Board's Title IX policy may be obtained from the School Board Office, from the Superintendent of Schools, or via the website: GAEAA, JCED, GAAA.
Per Louisiana H.C.R. 129, the Superintendent of Schools, Charley Lemons is the custodian of public records. Appropriately formatted F.O.I.A. requests should be submitted to the Superintendent in writing at: 510 Marshall Street, Cameron, LA. 70631
The Cameron Parish School System does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, religion, qualified handicap or disability.
Child Abuse Hotline - 1-855-4LA-KIDS (1-855-452-5437)
